azurerm_mariadb_firewall_rule.description: Manages a Firewall Rule for a MariaDB Server.

name.description: Specifies the name of the MariaDB Firewall Rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

server_name.description: Specifies the name of the MariaDB Server. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which the MariaDB Server exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

start_ip_address.description: Specifies the Start IP Address associated with this Firewall Rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

end_ip_address.description: Specifies the End IP Address associated with this Firewall Rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
end_ip_address.notes: The Azure feature `Allow access to Azure services` can be enabled by setting `start_ip_address` and `end_ip_address` to `0.0.0.0` which ([is documented in the Azure API Docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/sql/firewallrules/createorupdate)).

id.description: The ID of the MariaDB Firewall Rule.

create.description: Used when creating the MariaDB Firewall Rule.

update.description: Used when updating the MariaDB Firewall Rule.

read.description: Used when retrieving the MariaDB Firewall Rule.

delete.description: Used when deleting the MariaDB Firewall Rule.
